text: Hey everyone, I needed help with a time zone issue. I'm using custom CRM cards where I'm passing a datetime field from the webhook. The request is being sent in GMT but on the actual display card, it's showing GMT -4 although my user is on GMT +5:30.
Hi guys can anyone tell me that once app is published into marketplace can I change the redirect url ?

1. This is question about Email Template.

       I need to add custom font here, please help me add in templates
 2.  Next the question is about
       in the Marketing->Files & Templates->Design Tools

Please help me to get solution.
Thanks
Yep you should definitely be able to do that

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report.a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.
I have to say this is kinda funny, and on point.

Hello everyone! I have a use case that I've want to solve, but I haven't find a way, so anyone up for the challenge is more than welcome :slightly_smiling_face: .

Context:
I use HubSpot as my CMS and Pardot as my CRM. So, for visitor identification and tracking I use the Pardot tracking code. Plus, for the cookie management I use a third party tool called CookieFirst. Finally I've implemented Souce Buster for tracking and UTMs retrieval.

Problem:
Recently I've found that even if the user hasn't accepted, or denies the cookies... the HS cookies + source buster get's fired. Which gives me the problem that is not GDPR compliant.

Trying to solve it:
I've tried to do a custom script in CookieFirst to block HS y SourceBuster cookies to be fired before the user confirms. But, HS cookies gets being fired.

Question:
Does anyone have a custom script I can add in my HTML to block the HS cookies from being fired. I've confirmed with Customer Support and the HubSpotutk is not a mandatory cookie, so the CMS will keep on working even if I block this cookie. Nonetheless, I can't seem to be able to block it from being fired.

Any suggestion is more than welcome :clap: .
Thank you all in advance.
cc: <@U051RHP82QJ>

of course, really HubSpot products currently are meant for things with set prices but not quantities like services. for example X amount of hours of consulting
yeaah that's what i seemed to find - thanks for confirming!
How would I get the HubSpot owner ids? So the id’s of the users inside a HubSpot portal? I want to attach this to a form submission so the contact has a contact owner
you can use the owners api to do this: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/owners>
Specifically the Get page of owners:
Great. And which id will be the HubSpot owner id? Is it the id or the userid? I got both back in my response
Thanks!
`id` should be the owner id
<#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs>
OMG Thank you!

Hi All. I’m not sure if this is the proper channel so posting my question regarding PII here.
We have a use case where we need to remove, block (restrict), a contact’s PII information including their email address. Is there a way to accomplish this in HS?
GDPR
would work right?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts#endpoint?spec=POST-/crm/v3/objects/contacts/gdpr-delete>

Can you embed a HubSpot video on a Wordpress site?
Or, is that functionality only available on HubSpot landing pages?

Hey Andres, you might need to update to something like this.
```src: url('/hubfs/{{hub_id}}/website-theme-assets/fonts/ARSMaquettePro-Regular.eot');```
